text:
*[Bug 18797] New: R-4.4.1\src\main\relop.c  update string missing 'for'*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18797>

            Bug ID: 18797
           Summary: R-4.4.1\src\main\relop.c  update string missing 'for'
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.4.x
          Hardware: Other
                OS: Windows 64-bit
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Translations
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:w9204-rs@yahoo.com|w9204-rs@yahoo.com>

in E:\Downloads\R-4.4.1.tar\R-4.4.1\src\main  File:  relop.c

Copyright (C) 1997--2024  The R Core Team

Function :  static SEXP compute_language_relop(SEXP call, SEXP op, SEXP x, SEXP
y)

In:
        switch(PRIMVAL(op)) {
        case EQOP:
            return R_compute_identical(x, y, 16) ? R_TrueValue : R_FalseValue;
        case NEOP:
            return R_compute_identical(x, y, 16) ? R_FalseValue : R_TrueValue;
        default: errorcall(call,
                           _("comparison (%s) is not possible language types"),
                           PRIMNAME(op));
Line: _("comparison (%s) is not possible language types"),

Should be with 'for': _("comparison (%s) is not possible **for** language
types"

Referenced in: <https://github.com/phgrosjean/rfrench/issues/20>

y)

In:
        switch(PRIMVAL(op)) {
        case EQOP:
            return R_compute_identical(x, y, 16) ? R_TrueValue : R_FalseValue;
        case NEOP:
            return R_compute_identical(x, y, 16) ? R_FalseValue : R_TrueValue;
        default: errorcall(call,
                           _("comparison (%s) is not possible language types"),
                           PRIMNAME(op));

Should be with 'for': _("comparison (%s) is not possible **for** language
types"

--- Comment #2 from Christian Wia (<mailto:w9204-rs@yahoo.com|w9204-rs@yahoo.com>) ---
(In reply to Tomas Kalibera from comment #1)
> Please note that R-tools.pot (translations of messages from R package tools)
> has nothing to do with Rtools (tools to build R for Windows).

im sorry. So where to find the recipient to direct this kind of request ?

elements.text:
) ---
(In reply to Tomas Kalibera from comment #1)

Please note that R-tools.pot (translations of messages from R package tools)
has nothing to do with Rtools (tools to build R for Windows).
im sorry. So where to find the recipient to direct this kind of request ?
